t: Amazon: Don't Blame New World for GPU Deaths, Blame Card Makers (Update) | Tom's Hardware
s: October 8, 2021 - Amazon and PowerGPU confirm that New World is not to blame for GPU deaths. Instead it's a result of bad soldering problems, at least on EVGA cards, and bad GPU manufacturing for others.

s: July 22, 2021 - Amazon has a new video game, and it's reportedly causing major issues for players. The game is said to destroy an especially expensive type of graphics card, NVIDIA's RTX 3090.

t: Amazon's New World MMO is reportedly killing $1,500 Nvidia GPUs | PC Gamer
s: July 21, 2021 - Original story: The closed beta for Amazon's New World MMO just went live yesterday, and today there are multiple reports that it's somehow killing GeForce RTX 3090 graphics cards.

t: Playing Amazon's New World MMO Is Bricking RTX 3090 Graphics Cards | PCMag
s: July 22, 2021 - Original Story 7/21: If finding a graphics card wasn't hard enough already, now it seems you need to be careful which games are played once you have one. Amazon's massively multiplayer online (MMO) game New World is bricking GeForce RTX 3090 cards, according to reports.

t: Amazon's New MMO Is Killing Some High-End PC Graphics Cards [Update]
s: July 21, 2021 - The EVGA GeForce RTX 3090 FTW3 Ultra, a fine graphics card when it isn’t dead. ... Fortunately, the problem seems isolated to EVGA GeForce RTX 3090 FTW3 cards. Nvidia GPUs are released in multiple models across many manufacturers, and failures seem limited to the EVGA. Owners of other brands of RTX 3090 cards should be in the clear. The issue being limited to a single model of card also means that this is a hardware issue and not a problem with Amazon’s New World ...

t: Amazon's New World draws a lot of power from my GPU. Here's how I fixed it and avoided frying mine
s: Amazon have claimed that they’ve "fixed" their graphic card issues during the beta, but there are still reports of GPUs dying in the official release.

t: Amazon's New World Is Reportedly Frying High-End Graphics Cards
s: July 21, 2021 - The open beta for Amazon Games' massive multiplayer role-playing game, New World, is reportedly destroying players' expensive PC hardware.

t: Amazon responds to New World breaking Nvidia RTX 3090s and other GPUs
s: October 6, 2021 - Despite steps taken during New World’s beta, graphics cards from both AMD and Nvidia are at risk ... It seems like everyone is either currently playing New World or are stuck in long server queues to play Amazon Games' new MMO, with it now being the fifth-biggest Steam game of all time by ...

t: Amazon's New World MMO is still bricking GPUs, so be careful
s: October 29, 2021 - A user on Reddit played the full ... on his brand new PC with a GeForce RTX 3080 Ti inside. The post explains: "Just hours before live servers I decide to go back into the game due to anticipation and then my GPU fans go wild/loud and hangs the PC. I reset and the red VGA light appears on my motherboard......... sadge. I have since replaced my graphics card with my old 1070 which is now working fine (and set all settings to low)". Read more: EVGA RTX 3090s were killed in Amazon's New World from 'bad ...

t: EVGA is replacing the Nvidia RTX 3090 GPUs broken by Amazon's New World | TechRadar
s: July 26, 2021 - It was recently reported that some players invited to the closed beta for Amazon's upcoming MMO New World experienced catastrophic hardware issues thanks to the game pushing graphics card power consumption over their limit. EVGA GPUs appeared to be disproportionately affected, but the company ...
